pros: Neutral political culture, easy going and down to earth faculty and staff, students are cool, lots of opportunities to get involved. Great community.
cons: Some departments are more extremist and snowflakey than others.

pros: Supervisors and co-workers are great to work with, mostly.
cons: The benefits are disastrous. Their basic medical plan does not cover Intermountain Healthcare or the U. of U., you have to pay extra for those, and now the U. of U. was just dropped from in-network care, which resulted in my wife and I losing 90% of our doctors. This was already bad when the out-of-pocket is now over $8k for the high-deductible plan. I have lost money due to inflation for the past four years and the "cost of living" adjustments are laughable at best. I would stay working here if these two things were not issues, but they are tremendously bad issues. I am having to change jobs because of how bad the benefits and pay are. Do not work here if you depend on either. If this is a second, non-primary job, then this will work for you. However, if you are the main income/provider, look somewhere else.

job_title: Assistant Director, Donor Relations in Orem, UT
pros: Great benefits Get to help students
cons: A young university that has to overcome public perception

review_title: An amazing place to work at
job_title: Assistant Technician Records and Registration in Orem, UT
pros: Working here was an amazing experience. It was super fun to see how the school operated and to be able to help fellow students know how to achieve their dreams.
cons: There was no cons associated with the job.

review_title: Unless you’re a man, or LDS - don’t work here.
pros: Honestly, not really any pros.
cons: It was terrible. Such a boys club, and you were treated differently if you weren’t LDS and didn’t go on a mission. Being a female working here was hard enough, but adding on top of it that you’re not apart of the dominant religion added a whole other layer of difficult. And, they expect you to work at any hour - get a text at like 930pm expecting you to drop what you’re doing and work, and it was a part time job? Absolutely not doing that.

pros: Great environment. New facilities and enjoyable colleagues. Well-prepared students.
cons: As with anywhere, you never know if you're going to get as many classes as you want.

pros: Easy to go to school and work at the same time for students.
cons: Lots of red tape to get anything done.

pros: The school overall is awesome!
cons: President and higher ups have favorites. There is a hiring process, but even if the hiring committee finds someone suitable, the president, President Astrid Tuminez and her Cabinet chooses who they want overall. They veto everyone and if you speak up to the president, she takes on retaliation and makes it hard for you to move up and makes it miserable to work there, so you want to leave. ESPECIALLY if you are a person of color.

pros: No Taxes due to school
cons: Low Pay for the job

pros: They care about employees and work life balance.
cons: The pay is low and parking can be hard.

pros: Flexible scheduling, good coworkers, regular training and opportunity for small raises.
cons: May get bored if you teach a niche subject, leadership can sometimes micromanage.

pros: Great students and beautiful campus
cons: Pay is not great. Typical university politics.

review_title: Best place to work in Utah!

pros: The division I work in is very fun to work with, everyone is friendly. Benefits are great for me and my partner.

review_title: Laid back position, only a few busy times throughout the year

pros: Nice people, good pay, the job wasn't too hard.

pros: Very solid working atmosphere, enjoyable colleagues

pros: Really easy going interview with minimum questions

pros: Relatively easy to get funding, great coworkers, supportive administration, lots of good resources.

pros: Really great side job. Easy with my schedule and enjoyable work..
cons: Nothing bad to say here

pros: Flexible schedule, easy to work while going to school. Good for making a little money on the side while taking classes.
cons: You have to commit to working the entire semester. Grading is also very busy at the end of the semester, which makes it more difficult to finish classes strong.

pros: Big university, good state support, friendly coworkers, nice new buildings
cons: Bureaucracy (to be expected someplace this big).

review_title: Best Work Environment I've Worked in!
job_title: Intermediate Research Analyst in Orem, UT
pros: Treats employees as dynamic human beings - gave me more personal days and holidays off, my supervisor was always aware of me and checked in often for support, always offered necessary training, encouraged pursuing opportunities to advance in my career.
cons: The bureaucracy is the hardest thing about a university in general - there are always hoops to jump through, or permissions you need above you. It was hard to not feel like I was stepping on toes if I didn't agree with the approach of someone (not within my department usually) who was above me.

pros: Set your own times Low stress
cons: Students may try to contact you at inopportune times

review_title: Great university focused on engaged learning

cons: Any issues have more to do with higher ed than UVU specifically.

pros: Perfect for full time students.
cons: Busy periods of time when deadlines are approaching.

review_title: Amazing people with a focus on excellence and inclusion.1k
job_title: Systems Administrator III in Orem, UT

cons: Silos of control. Some inefficiencies.

job_title: Assistant Graphic Designer in Orem, UT
pros: Probably one of the best groups of people I had the honor of working with. Quirky, fun, often off the wall with their creative ideas, but they genuinely care about what you do and where you are going in life. They even helped me move apartments!
cons: Not really a con, but sometimes you get to do things outside your job description--such as guiding employers to and from the fairs, setting up and tearing down fair materials, etc. Not super glamorous work, but it's worthwhile.

pros: Well managed school. Good students.
cons: Large numbers of people on campus.

review_title: A place to go to school
pros: it is a good learning environment
cons: it is a little bit expensive

pros: Teaching is fun. Working with students is great.
cons: The position offers low pay and lecturers are not allowed to have a voice. Committee work is forbidden to lecturers, even to those who are experts in their field. Limited opportunity for advancement.

pros: Everything about UVU is great. The culture, the people, the location. 10/10 recommend.
cons: The pay. There just isn't a lot of money in Higher Education. If there was more money available, I would still be there.

review_title: Good for getting school paid for
job_title: Facility Service Representatives  in Orem, UT
pros: Full time employee get a tuition wavier,which gives employees a way to get through school.
cons: Pay is low, management is horrible. Extremely difficult to move departments. Some departments are looked down on. Horrendous office politics.

pros: Paycheck Some of the employees Most of the students
cons: Management No advancement potential Overworked

review_title: Writing Center was the best job I've had
job_title: Student Writing Tutor in Orem, UT
pros: Working at the Writing Center at UVU was the healthiest work environment I've ever been in. Very considerate of schedule, mental health, individual interests and personal growth.
cons: UVU treats employees very well, but work culture is pretty dependent on the department you work under. The Writing Center is the best job I've ever had. The marketing team I worked for at UVU was less professional, less considerate of work-life balance, and less organized than the Writing Center however.

pros: UVU is a fantastic employer. Their HR team truly cares about doing things right and taking care of folks. Managers give excellent and constructive feedback. Easily the best organization I have ever worked for. Benefits are also phenomenal.
cons: This is a public employer, so your base salary will probably not be the best.

pros: The environment is friendly and there are good benefits
cons: Too much administration compared to teaching faculty

pros: Always has things going on. Good atmosphere
cons: Politics, favoritism, lack of communication between departments.

pros: Inclusive University that really cares about students and staff.
cons: Education isn't a very lucrative field and that is true for UVU.

pros: Good work life balance, not much work for part timers
cons: Night shift time is bad for my sleeping time

pros: State job so it is secure. Good benefits.
cons: Management can be hit or miss

pros: The ability to have a flexible work environment as well as pursue an education from a university is a big plus.
cons: Like many State/Higher Ed institutions, the pay will never be competitive to the market so the trade-off is stability and education vs. the higher dollar amount you could make in a similar industry job.

pros: Super flexible scheduling and staff are willing to work with you to give you whatever hours you need to work around your school schedule
cons: As a student, you can only work up to 28 hours a week.

job_title: Academic Advisor I in Orem, UT
pros: UVU is good for entry level experience and typically isn't too demanding. The employer contribution to retirement is excellent (like all public universities in Utah). Insurance is also pretty good.
cons: Limited opportunities for advancement, even for a University. Typically pays less than other schools in the area. Current leadership doesn't care for shared governance and decisions are definitely forced from the top down. High employee turn-over in certain positions largely because of the limited pay and limited advancement.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Orem, UT
pros: Chill and good boss! very helpful on training!
cons: class schedule will be tricky to match the work schdule

review_title: Expect to beg for a raise and not get it for months/years
job_title: Audio Visual Services and Engineering in Orem, UT
pros:
Chill atmosphere
Great coworkers
Interesting job
On campus
cons: Management sucks and will force you to beg for a raise and moving up. Even after you have they will look for what you do wrong more than what you do right so they don't have to promote you. You get paid less than taco bell and wayyyy less than at other companies for the same job and experience.

review_title: Math Lab & Academic Tutoring is a great place to be

pros: Very flexible hours. Great management. Best administrative team I have ever worked for. Plenty of time to do homework when not helping students. Good pay for a student position.
cons: While good pay for a student position, it's still student pay.

pros: People do not know how to simply say what they think at UVU, so instead they will circuitously stab you in the back over and over. That is regardless of whether or not you are a member of the dominant faith.
cons: Culture, Salary. Backstabbing. Inept/corrupt 'leadership.'

job_title: Computer Science Tutor in Orem, UT

pros: My colleagues are lovely and supportive
cons: Lack of care for faculty work/life balance. Lack of opportunity for advancement and lack of support for professional development to advance if you are not tenured or on the tenure track. Salaries are underwhelming and there are many disparities between the salaries paid to male professors vs. Female professors.

review_title: Excellent place to work in IT
job_title: ERP Product Specialist in Provo, UT
pros:
14.2% employer contribution with no employee match needed.

Free Undergrad classes, can take 3 credit hours during work!
cons: None. Lack of close parking maybe? Offices in basements with no light? But you can just unplug your laptop and work in a nicer place on campus and still be at work!

review_title: One of the best places I've worked
job_title: Economics and Finance Tutor in Orem, UT
pros: Wonderful new space, alright pay ($13 an hour with option to increase with provided training), good management, and good co-workers
cons: Not a lot of cons to be honest. You get to do homework while you wait for people to come into the lab and are paid for your full time there. Trainings are paid. Management is open and transparent about what is happening. Great place to work. Biggest con is possibly not getting along with other tutors.

job_title: Academic Policy Officer in Provo, UT
pros: My supervisors support me in completing my responsibilities and they support me in both personal and professional development.
cons: Sometimes the salary does not seem competitive.

job_title: Technical Support Technician II in Orem, UT
pros: The people are great. The focus on forward technology is great. Like while we have legacy systems, most hardware and systems are constantly upgraded according to best industry practices. I don't think I've ever had such good access to new hardware and software. Most other companies are using such antiquated tech it's embarrassing. And reliance on old legacy systems, and very poor security practices. But at UVU they are very forward thinking with technology. When we had to transition to full remote classes over the pandemic it went off without any major issues because we already had systems and services in place to make the transition smooth.
cons:
Pay isn't as great. You can likely make more at another company. Though there is room to move up and get promotions though.

Some office politics with higher up departments prevented efficient hiring and replacement of needed positions.

pros: Great position for anyone looking for a job in college. The office was always very helpful with making sure your work schedule aligned with your classes. The work was intriguing and a great atmosphere.
cons: Pay would be lower than any other accounting job you could probably find outside of the college.

pros: I made so many friends here.
cons: Hard to get time off.

job_title: Library Circulation Aide in Orem, UT
pros: The people are so kind, supportive, flexible, and good. The Fulton Library administration and staff have worked together to make the library one of the best work environments I have ever worked in. I loved every shift I had there. Would highly recommend if you are looking for an on-campus job.
cons: I honestly don't have any.

review_title: It's good to be a Wolverine
pros: Great benefits and good people.

pros: The option to work from home when needed.
cons:
Recently faculty were asked to share thoughts about a recent controversial speaker on campus. There has been MUCH negative backlash to those who shared opinions.
Also, there is a tremendous lack of respect to faculty from the current UVU president and provost. Asking relevant questions and asking for data before making major decisions are made is treated by the president and provost with contentment. Someone who asks questions is seen as a ''problem."
The president has initiated a concept of "Exceptional Care" as part of the UVU mission. Care is not exhibited to faculty who have a difference of opinion or who ask important questions.

pros: chill environment to work. Easy money

review_title: UVU: a pretty good place to work!
pros:
Great benefits, decent class sizes in the English department; lots of freedom for a full-time teacher (we can design our own curriculum!); department monies are available for travel to conferences.

I'm treated like a professional.
cons:
No upward mobility: if you're not on the tenure track, you never will be. 

Workload is high: very little time for research and publishing. 

(but considering how hard it is to find a full-time position in the academy, these are petty annoyances at best)

pros: Supervisors are flexible with my schedule.

cons: If your working part time you can only work up to 28 hr/week regardless of how many jobs you have on campus

review_title: Great if you want experience in education
job_title: GEAR UP Tutor in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Flexible schedule, great supervisors, working with youth
cons: Low pay, raises only given with increased completed credits

pros: there is none at all
cons: lots of cons there are very many

review_title: The math lab at UVU is fantastic
pros: I like working at UVU as a tutor. They are very professional, all of the tutors know math very well and the setup in the lab is great. My boss was awesome and super friendly as well.
cons: The pay wasn't super high, but it was fair in my opinion.

pros:
-flexible work schedule 
-increased knowledge of course subject matter 
-great communication with professor
cons:
-inconsistent workload
-not much physical activity; sedentary

pros: Good coworkers and happy boss
cons: Poor wage for what I was doing.

pros: Low pressure work. Shift leads were respectful and understanding.
cons: Late at night (but worked for my school schedule).

pros: Great student job for those that go fulltime
cons: there are no cons that I can think of

review_title: Good Place to Work during school (Business Tutor)
pros: They work with our schedule.
cons: Sometimes tutoring can be difficult if you don't know the subject.

review_title: Poor leadership and vision with does not value diversity
pros: students and work life balance
cons: poor leadership in terms of deans, department chairs, and faculty

pros: Lots of flexibility, relatively stable
cons: Can’t exceed 30 hours which can be difficult

review_title: Great job, great people great benefits
job_title: Front Office Staff in Orem, UT
pros: Great job, great people great benefits
cons: I can not think of any at this time

pros: good environment and friendly people
cons: too many people doing the same

pros: You have to practice blind obedience to work their...
cons: You have to be mormon

pros: everything is awesome at uvu
cons: nothing is bad at uvuv

pros: Facilities and Student Community and Funding
cons: The location is not ideal

review_title: Nice Base Salary with Summers Off
job_title: Speech Communication Lecturer in Orem, UT
pros:
Excellent Department culture and professionalism
Great benefits
Clear expectations for the position
Schedule flexibility
Employee and student oriented regarding Covid-19 response
cons:
It's public education, so the pay isn't phenomenal.
As a Lecturer, often overlooked at Faculty Senate and University-level decisions.

pros: The exercise science department is tight knit, well informed, and cares about the students first.
cons: None that I can think of

pros: Adjusts your schedule as needed to meet your needs.
cons: Constantly asked to perform duties outside of what you were hired for. Increase responsibilities w/out increase pay.

pros: The education is very affordable.
cons: Compared to my previous University the quality of education leaves much to be desired.

pros: The overall mid-staff level culture is great. Good benefits.
cons: The upper level staff (managers, directors, VPs are terrible. No equal opportunity, favoritism, Harassment. HR department is a joke. PACE is a joke.

pros: Reasonable pay and benefits, great colleagues to work with, and an expanding location with diverse students.
cons: Organization can be top heavy and disorganized at times.

pros: Diverse team, healthy environment there
cons: Low hours, no opportunity to advance really

job_title: Testing Center Proctor in Orem, UT
pros: It was very diverse complete with so many things students can do and participate in
cons: Nothing was wrong for me

pros: Flexible scheduling for student employees
cons: We had to work late and weekends

job_title: Assistant Business Analyst in Orem, UT
pros: Management is super friendly! There are lots of opportunities to specialize in.
cons: They are still adjusting some services online because of COVID.

pros: Learning C# and SQL more in-depth
cons: Pay could be a bit higher since tutoring programming classes is not easy.

job_title: Operations Desk Supervisor in Orem, UT
pros: Easy Work, Awesome boss and non-stressful environment.
cons: There are no cons here.

pros: Flexibility is great. Decent pay.
cons: Hours worked per time paid

review_title: Review of Teaching at Utah Valley University
pros:
Lots of agreeable people to work with. 
The leaders of the English Department provide some informal training on how to teach, in the form of four one-hour seminars each semester. 
As long as you are a positive, encouraging teacher, the Eng Dept isn't too critical about how you teach your classes.
If you have trouble with students who cause problems in class, the Eng Dept is very supportive of teachers and helps them work through problems with troublesome students.
cons:
No offices are provided for adjunct teachers, so meeting with students outside the classroom can be a problem.
Most of my students come to the Intermediate Writing classes I teach with very little mastery of grammar, syntax, or organizational skills, almost as if they have not passed English 1010. It's like having a classroom full of failing students, who don't take good notes and seem not to even think about writing except when they are in the classroom. The students seem interested in only getting a good grade, not in learning to improve their writing skills.

pros: Great co-workers, kind people and busy atmosphere. Great holidays and the benefits were pretty good, I genuinely enjoyed the job, but I wasn't allowed to investigate ways to progress and streamline everyday tasks.
cons: Junior Management was horrid. They have no idea what they are doing, and don't know how to be mangers, they micromanage EVERYTHING and EVERYONE and the turnover is unbelievable and concerning.There's a reason no one wants to stay, and it continues to be one and the same- the management. Talented people deserve to be appreciated, and that is not happening.

review_title: Not what you would expect at a regular university
pros: I don't know yet, all I know is you have to deal with entitled students.
cons: I left my previous job to join this amazing teaching job only to realize that the standards of the department and students is so low.  Students are not at all held to normal university standards. The students basically run the show and the professors do what the students want. It is a classic example of the "Parent trying to be the student's best friend". So make tests easy so that students love you, allow plagiarism and cheating, otherwise you are being too harsh. Students have no respect for teachers I guess unless they are of the same religious background and are male. Classic problem with anything in Utah. Not to mention, the university brags about its increasing enrollment rates....but what about having the highest non-graduation rates? What are they doing about that?

pros: My team is like a family away from home! I have the opportunity to take classes free of charge and grow my education. Education and growth are always encouraged! There are a lot of on campus events that are not only enlightening but fun to attend. We now have Chick-Fil-A on campus! There is a lot of encouragement and growth in working with other departments and in new capacities.
cons: Parking is  a pain for employees and students alike. Some bathrooms still have single ply toilet paper. There are some politics/required qualifications that prevent very qualified and experienced people from moving up within the company. It is frustrating that positions cap out on pay rate even if the employee keeps doing more and being more valuable to their team.

pros:
Well-kept facilities.
Good resources professors can use to help students.
Strong benefits.
cons:
Work load was untenable.
Faculty in-fighting.
Tension between administration and academic departments.

review_title: I found my dream job on my first try
job_title: Learning and Development Coordinator in Orem, UT
pros: 14.2% retirement contribution with no employee contribution, $500+ for basically getting a physical and attending a couple of workshops through UVUFit, generous leave package, 12 paid holidays (plus usually you get two weeks off for Christmas), free full-tuition for you and your dependents,  free LinkedIn Learning account, tons of conferences and event discounts, professional development programs, great onboarding materials, you really feel like you are helping students, indoor campus, free parking pass, $50 from UCCU if you open an account as an employee, $10 per month on-campus gym, $7 food vouchers for Food Truck Friday, employee recognition/appreciation events
cons: There is a lot of bureaucracy and you regularly have to get multiple approvals for everything, depends on your supervisor(s)

job_title: Administrative Support V in Orem, UT
pros: Great benefits and room for growth. Lots of holidays off. Great environment. Great sense of helping the community, which was very rewarding.
cons: Not best pay or increase in pay options. It is a state funded school so there are many restrictions with pay and other things so that comes with the territory. Parking can be terrible depending on where you work on campus but working as an assistant it would have been impossible to not have a car and be able to complete tasks needed for that position.

pros: Flexibility, decent pay, decent benefits, but honestly not many positives to say about this university.  The universities has grown over the years mainly because parents want their kids in Utah county but many students can't get into BYU anymore so they go to UVU high instead.
cons: Lots of passive aggressive staff, employees are lazy and try to do the very bare minimum for their jobs and most get away with it. Tons of staff double dip and teach or prepare for class while doing their regular staff position and most supervisors look the other way. Environment breeds mediocrity, lies and unethical practices.

pros: Great co-workers. Very friendly environment because you see the same customers every day. Fun to work around airplanes. Pretty chill work when things are slow.
cons: Mario (the boss) does not reward good work. He makes you do degrading tasks like emptying his trash, running errands for him when he is perfectly capable of doing it on his own, etc. Horrible pay for the work that we do and the education that we have. People on the top somehow keep getting raises while those of us on the front lines get jack.

pros:
-Flexible Schedule 
-Good pay
-Good Co-workers
-Tuition benefits even for part time staff.
-Great opportunities for advancement for proactive staff members (must be willing to shuffle departments a little).
cons:
-Parking can be tough especially if you arrive after 9am.
-Some positions can be repetitive ( depends on what you position is and which department) 
-Public transportation can be limited if you work after 5-6pm

review_title: A growing program with a lot of pros
pros: UVU has state of the art training aircraft, friendly staff, and an positive environment for working. I've always enjoyed my job here, and being in the aviation industry in which I will make my career is an awesome perk. Furthermore, even though there are some frustrations management is open to new ideas and constantly looking for ways to improve.
cons: Work is limited to part time, with a max average of 27 hours a week. The pay isn't out of the park, but for an entry level job it's not the worst either.

review_title: A great place to work if you want a stable and secure job with significant autonomy but lacks a focus on greatness.
pros:
Autonomous
Secure
Ample time off
Stable
Altruistic
Organizational Growth
Opportunities to build a new program
Training and development
Community focused
Benefits
Retirement paid regardless of match
cons:
Reputation as a second-tier institution
Salary
Change is ponderous
Financial and other data is messy and hard to access
Raises are time-based, not merit based

pros: My coworkers and boss are awesome.  We try to do weekly lunches as a team or part of a team, and the work schedule is very flexible so you can work around your class schedule.  When you have down time you can do your homework.
cons: This particular position can get monotonous over time and can be boring at times but otherwise I have no complaints about the job.

review_title: I love working with University Students.
pros:
UVU is a Teaching University dedicated to Student Success and engagement.  
An open and inclusive university.
President Holland is accessible and known by a student body of 30,000+
Many student courses and programs engage students in project with companies in the community and around the world.
Students leave with a resume.
Grounds, buildings, and work areas are pleasant and well maintained.
cons:
Many levels of management in the administration.
Enrollment growth is outpacing student space.
Parking is extremely difficult on campus.
Politics between departments can get in the way of innovation at times.

pros: Benefits are fantastic (free tuition for full-time faculty and staff, plus a free parking pass), and the university setting is exciting. Also, starting Fall 2018 all employees will get a free UTA pass.
cons: Great benefits are traded off for lower pay. Typically one person is doing enough work for it to be 2 different jobs, though you wouldn't know it from what you're paid.

pros: The people working with the First Year Experience department are positive, high-energy people. The organization works hard to produce effective results, and I have had opportunities to grow and develop a number of important skills that I will be able to apply to any future resumé
cons: It's not always easy to work with freshmen; often the new students are dissatisfied with the mandatory orientation. It can be hard to maintain a constantly positive and high-energy attitude toward them. The work is fast-paced and demands a lot of energy. Regardless, I enjoy it.

pros: Fun Environment; working with students, instructors, and staff and airplanes is enjoyable.  The airport environment is always alive with interesting and enjoyable aviation.
cons: The job requires, at times, assignments that are not as fun.  Dispatchers are the primary labor force for any and all odd projects including

pros: UVU is up and coming and is very willing to be innovative in their practices. People are generally really awesome to work with and are motivated to help students from every background. It is cool to be a part of an institution like UVU that is growing so rapidly and is anticipated to continue to do so.
cons: Low pay and very bureaucratic. People generally do no work here to make lots of money. You really have to passionate about higher ed and the mission of UVU otherwise the bureaucracy and low pay will burn you out.

job_title: Web Tech and Applications Developer in Orem, UT
pros:
Learned a lot of useful skills relating to my field
Great flexibility, I was able to work another job and they were very flexible to work with that schedule
Very convenient to go to work after taking classes
cons: Low wages, but that's to be expected for an entry level educational job.

pros: The work is fulfilling (the majority of the time) since it is focused on helping students improve writing skills. I really enjoy the one-to-one aspect. The three bosses--Leigh Ann, Josh, and Rebecca--are truly amazing to work with. My co-workers are some of my favorite people.
cons: Some tutorials can feel unrewarding or emotionally draining. There isn't any upward mobility since it is for a university. There are also no full-time positions.

review_title: Great benefits, not so great management
pros: Free tuition for self and family. Generous time off and benefits. Flexible work schedule. Safe work environment. Great co-workers.
cons: Untrained and inexperienced managers. Managers are often recent graduates with no work experience and no training as managers. No support for employees with any grievances with management as the labor representatives are selected by management and subject to disciplinary action should they go against their bosses.

review_title: Great place to work!  Supportive environment.
pros: The coworkers have consistently been supportive and positive.  They create a great environment to have both the autonomy needed for creativity and a baseline of what needs to be taught.  I have not seen much politics but rather a focus on why we are there and doing a good job at it.  The people really make it a wonderful place to work!
cons: None that I saw.  Very professional and focused on the work at hand.

review_title: Great concerns about working at UVU--unhealthy environment
pros:
Opportunity to help students succeed. 
Retirement contributions by the State.
cons:
If you are not LDS, you are not accepted. More specifically, if you are not a LDS white male, you are not seen as bringing value to the University. As a women, my ideas and contributions to the discussion are not recognized.   The LDS men act as if  my position and role in the department are not on the same level as them. They consistently try and squash my ideas. 
Many people are not respectful of "other" lifestyles or religion choices if not LDS. 
HR policy support administrators and not faculty members. I have been a victim of bullying and HR does nothing about it.
Federal regulations (such as policies which are to help employees with medical issues) which are to help all employees are enforced at the expense of faculty and not helping them. HR sees policies as a way to protect the institution and not to help the faculty.  I have a pre-existing health condition which HR refuses to provide accommodation for after asking several times. 
HR is seen across campus as an office that hinders other departments and does not help departments or individuals. Other than hiring practices and the wellness program, their practices are a hindrance to the rest of the campus community.

pros: Somewhat flexible schedule has allowed me to work 25-30 hours a week while taking light load of college classes.  I had the opportunity to be promoted to work as a FT database specialist.  The atmosphere at work was very casual, friendly and a quite a bit of office lunches, employee luncheons etc.  I feel I am valued there as an employee.  I loved the tuition benefit that's available.
cons: Parking is difficult sometimes.  The position wasn't a very exciting one.  Lower wages are compensated by other benefits available.

review_title: Good company, good employees, a little stressful at times.
pros: They were great about working with my class schedule, and it was never an issue that I had a second job. The managers work with a lot of temporary employees, but I never felt like they were rude or condescending with the temporary or newly-hired regular employees. Most of the other employees were great to work with, and the environment was good.
cons: Being a campus bookstore, it got very busy at the beginning and end of every semester. It was definitely a high stress environment during those times.

review_title: Slow at moving forward with anything or granting permission to move ahead.
pros: Great benefits. Many of the people are very nice to work with. The location is lovely. Many of the faculty are forward-thinking and great to provide services for.
cons: Trying to get anything accomplished. Could just have been my department, but staff feel okay about taking off whenever they feel like it, even if it's at the busiest time of year. They feel little obligation to the people they work with to ensure enough coverage for the unit. Pay is low.

pros: A very friendly and relaxed atmosphere at workplace.  Tuition benefits, good health/dental insurance and 401K if you work full-time.  The best part is that there is a feeling of being part of a community, something bigger than your current team.  Constant updates on what is happening in the university, interesting lectures, sports events, and staff get-togethers foster more of a community spirit and camaraderie.
cons: Parking lot is often full, sea of students in the hallways, the salary is probably on the lower side.

job_title: Administrative Assistant III in Orem, UT
pros:
Free tuition, educational environment, beautiful campus, retirement benefits, working with others to improve lives. New gym area and cafeteria/ food court. 
Co-workers are great.
cons: Low salary, can be very political, academia hierarchy and executive level administration. People have their own agendas and the more power you have the more you get what you want, regardless of the greater good.

pros: Life/work balance is great. UVU gives great flexibility with time off/vacation. People are great and you have great support from mgmt. If you are looking for stability, it a great place to work
cons: Underpaid compared to similar positions on the market. UVU is a state school, so be prepared to sacrifice your pay. Position requirements are very high. Very hard to advance

pros: Smaller class sizes, allowing you to really focus on teaching. Excellent faculty to work with, depending on department. You can continue your education, if you want.
cons: You won't make ends meet with adjunct pay. Often given a course to teach within a week of the semester starting without a developed curriculum. You are limited to teaching 9 credits per semester at around $1,000 per credit per semester. It's not often that you'll get the full 9 credits all three semesters.

pros: I got to work with some amazing faculty in the Illustration Department for a couple of years as an adjunct faculty member. I really enjoyed the atmosphere and the engaging students that I had the opportunity to teach.
cons: None, they were all great. I do wish that the facilities and the major were more deeply supported by the school at large, but the faculty were doing amazing things with the space and resources available to them.

pros: The people you work with are amazing. Great atmosphere, they always have great side benefits for employees  (like money off of food truck friday, discount at the drink place on campus.)
cons: There weren't many downsides to working there. The pay was a little low, and if you're part time you miss out on quite a few perks of full time employees.

pros: As an adjunct, I didn't need a lot of previous experience to teach at UVU. So teaching there gave me a foot in the door and helped me gain experience as a teacher that has helped me when looking for more stable employment.
cons: I worked as an adjunct. The pay per hour was good, but I wasn't paid for prep time. Also, at least for me, there was no guarantee of work for the next semester(s).

pros: Convenient workplace for students, school and work in the same package.  I work in a great department, which is really the best buffer against the insane policies of the administration.
cons: Low pay, inflated employment requirements, lower tier workers are all workstudy students, no benefits, low hours.  Food available on campus rivals the expense of that found in the airport, this includes the below grade cafeteria.

review_title: Great atmosphere and benefits at UVU
job_title: Administrative Support III in Orem, UT
pros: The whole time I worked at UVU I always had a great supervisors. The health insurance is great. I always hada a nice work schedule. And my job was flexible when I needed time off for personal, sick or vacation reasons.
cons: The pay is much lower than the corporate world. There is absolutely no chance for advancement.

pros:
-UVU gives you the opportunity to progress and they really value your ideas. 
-It is a comfortable environment where you are urged to be yourself.
-You can build a strong fun relationship with your supervisors.
-Flexible schedules.
cons:
-Extremely laid back (can be a pro if you see it that way)
-Constantly working with somebody new (35,000+ students)
-Flexible schedules (pro and con)

pros: Great staff; supervisor listens and responds to teacher concerns. Enjoy working with the adult students. They are there because they want to be.
cons: In general, we aren't paid for prep time, which takes a great salary and cuts it by at least a third.  Teaching is done in the evening hours, which does not a budget make.

review_title: Great experience to start your career
job_title: Front End Web Developer in Orem, UT
pros: Supportive management. They work with your schedule if you're a student. 3 free credits per semester. The turn-around is really high because team members are often poached for better paying jobs (that could be you!).
cons: The pay is significantly below market, no benefits to speak of.

pros: Good work/life balance and the people are usually genuine and friendly.
cons: The university is not really that great at training its managers and leaders in how to manage and lead. There is poor accountability and HR is terrible at addressing employees complaints and issues. Also, like most higher education or government jobs, the salary is fairly low.

pros: The people I work with are cool. My boss is very hands-off, which has helped me gain valuable experience in the people skills department.
cons: There is nothing negative about working here as far as I'm concerned. The directors are respectful of your skill set and expect you to take care of the clients.

review_title: They do not value the contributions of part-time faculty.
pros: There are lots of positions for adjuncts open because they do the majority of the teaching.
cons: Every time a new tenure-track associate is assigned to manage the adjuncts, they skew the curriculum so that they can use the work of the adjuncts and student body to support their latest publication project.

pros: Working at the alumni house came along with many perks, including lots of delicious free food leftovers!
cons: Having to sit at computer all day long got old after a while, but hey... It's a job!

pros: I work with great people who know their stuff and have practical, real world experience in their field. I teach one upper level class to students who are very into their major, so they are engaged and talented.
cons: I'd teach more hours if they were available.

job_title: Facilities Project Manager in Orem, UT
pros: UVU has a new President.  President Tuminez is very dynamic, working to change the "culture".
cons:
Specific to the Department that I worked; there is a problem with "Senior" management.  Employees are subjected to "gaslighting".   

Overall there are significant problems at UVU with;  cronyism (good old boy network - predominant religious beliefs ), nepotism, and bigotry!

review_title: Up and Coming University with huge potential
pros:
Growing University with lots of positions
Close knit network in some departments
OK pay with decent benefits
cons:
It's all about who you know.
HR Department is barely involved in the branches of the University. Too many departments have free reign and are money-suckers.

review_title: UVU is fantastic place to work as a student
pros: UVU is a great university to work for. Especially if you are a full time student, because you will be eligible for a tuition waiver which in itself is a HUGE plus.
cons: Pay wasn't as competitive as some employees would hope.

pros: UVU is a fantastic University! The focus on student success is evident, and things are constantly changing. It makes for an engaging workplace, where it is possible to make improvements.
cons: UVU is growing extremely quickly so each employee does the work of 2-5 people. It an get extremely exhausting.

review_title: Depends on what department you’re in
pros: Good benefits, they work around my school schedule and are flexible with my hours.  My chair is amazing and caring about the admin and faculty.
cons: Low wages, too many politics and unethical working practices.  Everything is slow to process at the university and a lot of the professors don’t do their jobs.

review_title: Great place to work as a student! They treat their employees very well.
pros:
Extremely flexible hours (I worked as a math tutor).
Decent pay.
Care about their employees.
Good work hours for students.
cons: Many student jobs aren't full time, so make sure you consider the max amount of hours you're allotted for specific jobs.

pros: The other employees, the managing staff members, and the challenge of a completely different workload every shift.
cons: The nagging to keep trying to level up to reach different certification levels as a tutor. There is no place to just relax.

pros: Generous paid vacation and sick leave
cons: Management is not supportive and doesn't listen to the individuals that report to them. Not a progressive work environment. Poor onboarding. Pay is lower than industry standards. Employees are expected to "do more with less," but aren't appreciated or recognized for their efforts.

review_title: Not the best place to work
pros: People at the same job level as me are quite nice and lovely to work with.
cons:
-Bad pay
-Ignored by management or worse, treated like you are an intern. 
-Absolutely no incentives to work there

pros: I get to work with some of the best people. They are smart, funny, respectful, and kind.
cons: There are not many opportunities to move up in academic advising at UVU. I love the people I work with, the campus and atmosphere, but not a lot you can do to advance. The money is below average. Parking is a nightmare.

review_title: Great place to work, but pay will be lower.
pros: Great Atmosphere, and great benefits. I also loved that I was able to take courses and management accommodated if classes were during work hours.
cons: Salaries are generally lower than you would get while working for corporations.

job_title: Data & Resource Counselor in Provo, UT
pros: Awesome health benefits, literally best benefits I've ever had. Great co-workers, fantastic company culture
cons: Lower pay than most places, but it's worth the trade-off in how well they treat and how they understand you aren't just an employee; you have a life, children, etc. that you need to take care of too.

review_title: UVU is a GREAT place to work!
pros:
Dynamic environment
Focused on student success
Supportive Administration
Strong company values
Transparent funding and budgetary decisions
Welcoming to students from all backgrounds and ability levels 
Constantly changing and improving
cons:
Politics are evident in various departments
Very few opportunities to advance
Education funding resources are limited
Many administrators are stuck in their ways

job_title: Media Services Technician in Orem, UT
pros: Fun, busy, great schedules, holidays are supper fun, family oriented, looking for the best way to take care of the students.
cons: Politics is a joke, wasted money, lower employees don't matter, organization is sloppy, groups do not work well together.

review_title: I was a tutor and TA.  It was pretty good.
pros: I had a very flexible schedule and was allowed to set my own hours for tutoring.  The University staff is generally helpful.
cons: The pay for TA and Tutor positions is very low.  Especially considering tutors typically charge $20 per hour or more on Craigslist and other places.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Orem Station, UT
pros: I work for Justin Hansen at UVU and he is a great boss for students. He pushes students to work well and accomplish a lot. While still being easy to work for and using a hands-off approach so that students can complete projects on their own time frame.
cons: benefits, no PTO, somewhat monotonous work.

review_title: Great place to work while going to school. Management was great to work with
pros: Great place to work while earning a collage degree. Management was very understanding about tutors switching schedules in order meet school demands.  Pay was fair for a part time position.
cons: Difficult to increase hours during summer months

pros: Awesome sick/vacation/401 k policy, great people (both employees and students) always something new, challenging work with creativity encouraged, did i mention the people? Really stellar people in every department I worked with.
cons: Pay isn’t competitive, but in theory the benefits package helps compensate. Can sometimes feel a little siloed between departments

review_title: One of the best jobs I have ever had.
job_title: Writing Center Tutor in Orem, UT
pros: One of the best jobs I have ever had. The work culture is phenomenal and you feel like you can make a difference.
cons: Hours are a little tricky to manage but more often than not people are willing to cover or trade shifts.

review_title: Good for a short-term part time job
pros: My job was to vacuum the library, and as long as I showed up on time and did my job there was little management. Easy work, just put my headphones on and walked around vacuuming.
cons:
The hours were from 9:15PM - 1:15 AM
Little social interaction

review_title: Great environment but typically poor managment
job_title: Desktop Support Technician in Milford, CT
pros: Free tuition benefit, all indoors, plenty of food places to grab a bite.
cons: Hard to move up, management doesn't keep up with ongoing projects, clique groups, good ideas are overlooked a lot. Not very good compensation.

review_title: Great place to work on campus
pros: Get to meet people. Flexible hours. You used to get a discount on books in you work during the busy season.
cons: Low pay. Some students are mean if they don't get their way or you can't return their book for some reason.

review_title: Not a bad place to work
job_title: Physics Research Assistant in Orem, UT
pros: The atmosphere is fairly laid back. There are a lot of opportunities to do research for student here.
cons: The pay is not amazing, if you get any money at all. Physics department seems to not get a ton of attention by upper management.

review_title: Adjunct Professors Barely Earn Minimum Wage
pros: Relaxing environment if interested in academia
cons: Miserable pay, enormous classes, and professors who will not give out A's or F's.

review_title: Great company, but restricted in growth
pros: UVU provides outstanding benefits, and a great work environment.  They serve thousands of students quickly and efficiently, more than fulfilling their mission.
cons:
UVU does not provide many growth opportunities and give small raises at best.  Some positions don’t even make livable
Salaries.

pros: Access to great equipment you need to know about in the industry. Coworkers willing to teach you if you're willing to ask. Good place to develop your reel.
cons: Not given much real responsibility. Pretty low pay, but it is an entering-the-industry job.

review_title: Great place to go to school and work
pros: Great to work while going to school. Make sure to apply to a job that corresponds/related to your major. They are very flexible with your schedule.
cons: No cons at this time.

pros: Safe and friendly environment- Building relationships and getting support from other departments-NETWORKING is slick at UVU
cons: You can tirelessly work over your salaried hours, you could be worth so much more but ...Very seldom pay increases

review_title: It has been a great Job
pros: I have been working there for 25 years and have enjoyed the students that I have been able to work with over the years.
cons: Need a more competitive salary

review_title: Working in the UVU Theater Costume Shop
pros: Flexible around your class schedule.
cons: Not a lot of days off and the pay doesn't cover much in the way of student expenses/living expenses.

pros:
Easy going company, can be a little too easy going at times, but it's nice to have.
Friendly atmosphere/environment
cons:
Often higher leadership seems detached from the employee base
School often plays copy-cat with policies/initiatives emulating rival Universities, unable to innovate on own.

pros: Nice environment and you are treated as family. You are assigned to a professor and work daily in projects and other assignments
cons: Not allow any other job. This is a job for Mba students only. There are just few positions available every year.

review_title: Good place for people who wants to have a safe and stable job.
job_title: IT Area Manager in Orem, UT
pros: Great atmosphere / Mostly great people and you always feel that you are doing something important.
cons: Politics play a big role. Its not what you know, is who you know.

pros: Best quality gear, well trained techs, and good management.  Low stress, flexible schedule, great opportunity to learn installation from pro's.
cons: Only part time, hard to get full time job, underpaid compared with similar positions in the corporate world.

pros: Fun people, growing university, and good leadership. I felt like I was a part of something greater than myself.
cons: I worked in a tiny little office but I have learned that it has since been moved to another location.

pros:
Very dynamic and exciting. On cutting edge of best practices in Student Affairs and many Academic Affairs departments.
Great people
Great atmosphere
For the most part, very transparent.
cons: Like anywhere you have pockets of people who like to bicker and play politics.

review_title: Working for UVU has been considerably relaxed, but offers no real financial incentives.
pros: Opportunities to review material related to your course of study. Flexible hours with class schedules.
cons: Low pay, no opportunities for advancement.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Orem, UT
pros: UVU is very flexible and diversified. It is expanding so fast and hiring lots of awesome faculties.
cons: It needs to improve its reputation. Lots of people have misunderstanding.

Good Pay
Good People
Good Kids/Students

Free tuition

pros: I love the coworkers and the other mechanics on the floor. I love the flight instructors and the students that are making their dreams come true.

review_title: Great if you're a student needing a little extra money while going to school

Work schedule conducive to student learning environment

cons: Since it's a university the pay isn't amazing.

pros: Increadible culture, the ability to go to work and school in the same location, and job security.

pros: You get to work with well trained staff and employees. Have the opportunity to help students.
cons: Sometimes there are weird hours depending on the job.

pros: The university is growing, which makes it an exciting place to work.
cons: Stuck in a part-time position despite holding a PhD and applying for several full time positions.

pros: Good benefits, great work/life balance, as most departments will work with your schedule. It's very convenient to be able to work where you go to school too.
cons: Not a lot of vertical movement. Below average pay.

pros: Benefits, waived tuition, location, nice building and beautiful grounds

pros: Time for homework, interaction with tech, good immediate boss (KV), builds patience, great colleagues
